item.title: 232 Amtrak Passengers Stranded In Rural West Virginia Since Friday Night
item.description: 232 Amtrak Passengers Stranded In Rural West Virginia Since Friday Night [Trainlopnik]: ... http://t.co/tlmQW23w #Jalopnik
item.content:encoded: 232 Amtrak Passengers Stranded In Rural West Virginia Since Friday Night [Trainlopnik]: ... http://t.co/tlmQW23w #Jalopnik Passengers on Amtrak's Cardinal service (Train 51) heading toward Chicago, Illinois from New York have been stranded in West Virginia since approximately 8:00 pm due to last night's storms, Jalopnik can confirm. Amtrak says 232 passengers were on board when downed trees forced them to stop. It'll be another few hours before some of them are able to move again on buses, while others are stuck on the train for an indefinite amount of time. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: jalopnik.com

item.title: Eastern US storms kill 13, cut power to millions
item.description: Update: Eastern US storms kill at least 13; emergencies declared in 4 states, District of Columbia - @AP http://t.co/I0TZSEhj
item.content:encoded: Update: Eastern US storms kill at least 13; emergencies declared in 4 states, District of Columbia - @AP http://t.co/I0TZSEhj Millions across the mid-Atlantic region sweltered Saturday in the aftermath of violent storms that pummeled the eastern U.S. with high winds and downed trees, killing at least 13 people and leaving 3 million without power during a triple-digit heat wave. Link - Trackbacks
